item.title: Building native Windows Urbit binaries
item.description: Last month, a PR was published by locpyl-tidnyd to the Urbit Github, containing instructions and a build environment for the compilation of static, Windows-native Urbit executables(!), for the eventual purpose of an official Windows binary distribution. I am frankly amazed that this is even possible. As somebody who has encouraged many friends to try out a comet, the biggest hurdle has been convincing them to set up a Linux environment – the source of two previous tutorials on this blog.
